column1: The sky too has its changes
column2: but they are less marked than those of the vegetation and the river. Clouds map it up at times
column3: but it is normally a dome of blending tints
column4: and the main tint blue. By day the blue will pale down into white where it touches the white of the land
column5: after sunset it has a new circumference—orange
column6: melting upwards into tenderest purple. But the core of blue persists
column7: and so it is by night. Then the stars hang like lamps from the immense vault. The distance between the vault and them is as nothing to the distance behind them

column11: but when the earth shall be beautiful. By herself she can do little—only feeble outbursts of flowers. But when the sky chooses
column12: glory can rain into the Chandrapore bazaars or a benediction pass from horizon to horizon.
